Source code for objutils.readers

#!/usr/bin/env python

__version__ = "0.1.0"

import os
import struct




[docs]
class PlainBinaryReader:
    LITTLE_ENDIAN = "<"
    BIG_ENDIAN = ">"

    def __init__(self, image, byte_order_prefix="@"):
        self.image = image
        self.image.seek(0, os.SEEK_END)
        self._size = self.image.tell()
        self.image.seek(0, os.SEEK_SET)
        self.byte_order_prefix = byte_order_prefix
        self.pos = 0



[docs]
    def _get_pos(self):
        return self.image.tell()





[docs]
    def _set_pos(self, pos):
        self.image.seek(pos, os.SEEK_SET)





[docs]
    def _get_size(self):
        return self._size





[docs]
    def reset(self):
        self.pos = 0





[docs]
    def next_byte(self):
        return self.u8()





[docs]
    def value(self, conversion_code, size):
        (res,) = struct.unpack(
            "%c%c"
            % (
                self.byte_order_prefix,
                conversion_code,
            ),
            self.image.read(size),
        )
        return res





[docs]
    def u8(self):
        return self.value("B", 1)





[docs]
    def u16(self):
        return self.value("H", 2)





[docs]
    def u32(self):
        return self.value("L", 4)





[docs]
    def u64(self):
        return self.value("Q", 8)





[docs]
    def s8(self):
        return self.value("b", 1)





[docs]
    def s16(self):
        return self.value("h", 2)





[docs]
    def s32(self):
        return self.value("l", 4)





[docs]
    def s64(self):
        return self.value("q", 8)





[docs]
    def uleb(self):
        result = 0
        shift = 0
        while True:
            bval = self.next_byte()
            result |= (bval & 0x7F) << shift
            if bval & 0x80 == 0:
                break
            shift += 7
        return result





[docs]
    def sleb(self):
        result = 0
        shift = 0
        idx = 0
        while True:
            bval = self.next_byte()
            result |= (bval & 0x7F) << shift
            shift += 7
            idx += 1
            if bval & 0x80 == 0:
                break
        if (shift < 32) or (bval & 0x40) == 0x40:
            mask = -(1 << (idx * 7))
            result |= mask
        return result





[docs]
    def asciiz(self):
        result = []
        while True:
            ch = self.next_byte()
            if ch == 0:
                break
            else:
                result.append(ch)
        return "".join(chr(c) for c in result)



    pos = property(_get_pos, _set_pos)
    size = property(_get_size)
